## DataView interface

Temporary Data View interface. TODO: Write/review documentation

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface DataView 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [rows](./spotfire-api.dataview.rows.md) | <code>{</code><br/><code>        [Symbol.asyncIterator](): AsyncIterator&lt;DataViewRow&gt;;</code><br/><code>    }</code> | The rows property can be used to asynchronously iterate all rows via the <code>for await ()</code> syntax.<!-- -->NOTE: The rows can only be iterated once.<!-- -->In older JavaScript environments the iterator can be retrieved via the getIterator() method. |

## Methods

|  Method | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [clearMarking()](./spotfire-api.dataview.clearmarking.md) | Clears the current marking |
|  [getError()](./spotfire-api.dataview.geterror.md) | Gets an error message when the dataView is not valid. |
|  [getIterator()](./spotfire-api.dataview.getiterator.md) | Gets the row iterator. The iterator is used to retrieve rows from the data view. The iterator can only be retrieved and consumed once per data view.<!-- -->Using the iterator directly allows much more flexibility compared to the <code>getAllRows</code> helper function. It is possible to check if the dataView is valid and abort the fetch if needed. It is also possible to track progress since the total row count is known via the <code>getRowCount</code> method. |
|  [getMetadata()](./spotfire-api.dataview.getmetadata.md) | Returns metadata about the data view. Returns null if the dataview is invalid. |
|  [isValid()](./spotfire-api.dataview.isvalid.md) | Gets a value indicating if the dataView is valid. When valid, the contents of the dataView can be accessed using getAllRows or getIterator. When not valid, use getError to get a description of the issue. |
|  [mark(rows)](./spotfire-api.dataview.mark.md) | Mark a set of rows. |
